001package pkg_class;
002import pkg_class.pkg_room.Door;
003import pkg_class.pkg_item.ItemList;
004
005import java.util.HashMap;
006import java.util.Map.Entry;
007import java.util.Arrays;
008
009/**
010 * This class is part of the RPandaScape application. 
011 * RPandaScape is a very simple, text based adventure game.  
012 * 
013 * A "Room" represents one location in the scenery of the game. It is 
014 * connected to other rooms via exits. For each existing exit, the room 
015 * stores a reference to the neighboring room.
016 * All the rooms have an ItemList that can be composed of Items.
017 * 
018 * @author Elie DUBOUX
019 * @version 2021.12.12
020 * @see ItemList
021 */
022public class Room
023{
024    /**
025     * The name.
026     */
027    protected String aName;
028    /**
029     * The description.
030     */
031    protected String aDescription;
032    /**
033     * The exits.
034     */
035    private HashMap<String, Room> aExits;
036    /**
037     * The doors.
038     */
039    private HashMap<String, Door> aDoors;
040    /**
041     * The path to the image.
042     */
043    protected String aImage;
044    /**
045     * The items.
046     */
047    protected ItemList aItems;
048    /**
049     * The Pnjs
050     */
051    private HashMap<String,Pnj> aPnjs;
052    /**
053     * The directions possible.
054     */
055    protected String[] aDirectionsPossible;
056    /**
057     * Room empty.
058     */
059    public static final Room UNKNOWN_DIRECTION = new Room("", "", null);
060
061    /**
062     * Create a room described "description" with an image. Initially, it has
063     * no exits.
064     * @param pName The name of the room.
065     * @param pDescription The room's description.
066     * @param pImage The path to the image of the room.
067     */
068    public Room(final String pName, final String pDescription, final String pImage)
069    {
070        this.aName        = pName;
071        this.aDescription = pDescription;
072        this.aExits       = new HashMap<String, Room>();
073        this.aDoors       = new HashMap<String, Door>();
074        this.aPnjs        = new HashMap<String, Pnj >();
075        this.aImage       = pImage;
076        this.aItems       = new ItemList();
077        this.aDirectionsPossible = new String[]{"north", "south", "east", "west", "up", "down"};
078    }//Room()
079    
080    /**
081     * Check if there are pnj in the room.
082     * @return True if there is no pnj in the room,
083     * false otherwise.
084     */
085    public boolean isPnjsEmpty()
086    {
087        return this.aPnjs.isEmpty();
088    }//isPnjsEmpty()
089    
090    /**
091     * Check if there is only one pnj in the room.
092     * @return True if there is only one,
093     * false otherwise.
094     */
095    public boolean isOnePnj()
096    {
097        return this.aPnjs.size() == 1;
098    }//isOnePnj()
099    
100    /**
101     * Add a new pnj to the room.
102     * @param pPnj The pnj.
103     */
104    public void addPnj(final Pnj pPnj)
105    {
106        this.aPnjs.put(pPnj.getName(), pPnj);
107    }//addPnj()
108    
109    /**
110     * Remove a given pnj from the room.
111     * @param pPnj The pnj.
112     */
113    public void removePnj(final Pnj pPnj)
114    {
115        this.aPnjs.remove(pPnj.getName());
116    }//removePnj()
117    
118    /**
119     * Check if the room is a trap door.
120     * @param pPreviousRoom The previous room.
121     * @return True if the player can go back to the previous room,
122     * false otherwise.
123     */
124    public boolean isBackPossible(final Room pPreviousRoom)
125    {
126        for (Room vRoom : this.aExits.values())
127            if (vRoom == pPreviousRoom)
128                return true;
129        return false;
130    }//isBackPossible()
131    
132    /**
133     * Check if it's possible to remove the item X time(s).
134     * @param pItem The Item.
135     * @param pItemNb The number of time.
136     * @return True if the items can be removed,
137     * false if not.
138     */
139    public boolean isRemovePossible(final Item pItem, final int pItemNb)
140    {
141        return this.aItems.hasEnough(pItem, pItemNb);
142    }//isRemovePossible()
143    
144    /**
145     * Add an item X time(s) to the room.
146     * @param pItem The item.
147     * @param pItemNb The number of the item added.
148     */
149    public void addItems(final Item pItem, final int pItemNb)
150    {
151        this.aItems.addItems(pItem, pItemNb);
152    }//addItem()
153    
154    /**
155     * Remove an item X time(s) to the room.
156     * @param pItem The item.
157     * @param pItemNb The number of the item added.
158     */
159    public void removeItems(final Item pItem, final int pItemNb)
160    {
161        this.aItems.removeItems(pItem, pItemNb);
162    }//removeItems()
163    
164    /**
165     * Get the item by giving his name.
166     * @param pItemName The name of the item.
167     * @return The item.
168     */
169    public Item getItem(final String pItemName)
170    {
171        return this.aItems.getItem(pItemName);
172    }//getItem()
173    
174    /**
175     * Add the given neighbor room in the given direction.
176     * @param pDirection The direction.
177     * @param pNeighbor The neighbor.
178     */
179    public void setExit(final String pDirection, final Room pNeighbor)
180    {
181        this.aExits.put(pDirection, pNeighbor);
182    }//setExit()
183    
184    /**
185     * Add a door in the given direction.
186     * @param pDirection The direction.
187     * @param pDoor The Door.
188     */
189    public void setDoor(final String pDirection, final Door pDoor)
190    {
191        this.aDoors.put(pDirection, pDoor);
192    }//setExit()
193    
194    /**
195     * Allows other classes to get the exit of the room in the given direction.
196     * @param pDirection The direction.
197     * @return The exit is a room but can be also UNKNOWN_DIRECTION or null.
198     */
199    public Room getExit(final String pDirection)
200    {
201        // the case where the direction is not "north", "south", "east", "west", "up" or "down".
202        if (!Arrays.asList(this.aDirectionsPossible).contains(pDirection))
203            return UNKNOWN_DIRECTION;
204            
205        return this.aExits.get(pDirection);
206    }//getExit
207    
208    /**
209     * Return the door in the given direction.
210     * @param pDirection The given direction.
211     * @return The door.
212     */
213    public Door getDoor(final String pDirection)
214    {
215        return this.aDoors.get(pDirection);
216    }
217    
218    /**
219     * Return the short description of the room.
220     * @return The short description.
221     */
222    public String getShortDescription()
223    {
224        return this.aDescription;
225    }//getShortDescription()
226    
227    /**
228     * Return a string describing the room's exits, for example
229     * "Exits: north west".
230     * @return Details of the room's exits.
231     */
232    public String getExitString()
233    {
234        StringBuilder vExits = new StringBuilder("Exits:");
235        for (String vOneExit : this.aExits.keySet())
236            vExits.append(" " + vOneExit);
237            
238        return vExits.toString();
239    }//getExitString()
240    
241    /**
242     * Return a string describing the items in the room.
243     * @return Details of the room's items.
244     */
245    public String getItemsString()
246    {
247        return "Items in the room :\n" + this.aItems.toString();
248    }//getItemString()
249    
250    /**
251     * Return the room"s pnjs.
252     * @return Details of the room's pnjs
253     */
254    public String getPnjsString()
255    {
256        if (this.isPnjsEmpty())
257            return "There is no pnj in this room.";
258        
259        StringBuilder vPnjs = new StringBuilder("Pnj(s) in the room:");
260        for (String vPnjName : this.aPnjs.keySet())
261            vPnjs.append(" " + vPnjName);
262            
263        return vPnjs.toString();
264    }//getPnjsString()
265    
266    /**
267     * Return a long description of this room, of the form :
268     *      You are near a little lake with a waterfall.
269     *      Item(s) : seaweed(2) daisy(10)
270     *      Exits : south west
271     * 
272     * @return A description of the room, including exits and items.
273     */
274    public String getLongDescription()
275    {
276        return ("You are at the " + this.aName + " room." +
277                "\n" + this.aDescription + 
278                "\n" + this.getItemsString() +
279                "\n" + this.getPnjsString()+
280                "\n" + this.getExitString()) ;
281    }//getLongDescription()
282    
283    /**
284     * Return a string describing the room's image name
285     * @return The path to the image.
286     */
287    public String getImage()
288    {
289        return this.aImage;
290    }//getImageName()
291    
292    /**
293     * Return the name of the room.
294     * @return The name of the room.
295     */
296    public String getName()
297    {
298        return this.aName;
299    }//getName()
300    
301    /**
302     * Return the pnj with the name given.
303     * Can be null.
304     * @param pPnjName The given name.
305     * @return The pnj.
306     */
307    public Pnj getPnj(final String pPnjName)
308    {
309        return this.aPnjs.get(pPnjName);
310    }//getPnj()
311    
312    /**
313     * Method called when there is only one pnj.
314     * Return the pnj.
315     * @return The pnj.
316     */
317    public Pnj getPnj()
318    {
319        Entry<String,Pnj> vEntry = this.aPnjs.entrySet().iterator().next();
320        return vEntry.getValue();
321    }//getPnj()
322} // Room
